availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Gross (Harlan County farmer and soldier)

body.p: Harlan County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Edmund Gross and Hester Gross. Married to Drucilla Gross. Father of Edmond Gross, Jacob Gross, Elizabeth Gross, and Perline Gross. Farmer in Harlan County in 1860. First lieutenant in the Harlan County Battalion of Kentucky State Militia from October 1862 to January 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County, p. 67.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harlan County, District 5, p. 5.
